result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wakim Leon Bryant Jr

records.addlTxt: -received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Wakim Leon Bryant Jr in Court, in custody.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in Court for Wakim Leon Bryant Jr.  Attorney Jacob Daniel Corr in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for SPPEDY Jury Trial. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. 

STATE ORALLY AMENDED COUNT X TO REMOVE PENALTY ENHANCER: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Sec. 939.63(1)(b).  

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his/her rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the Information, and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 

Defense requested a Pre-Sentence Investigation (PSI). Court granted request. 

Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing hearing, Branch 46. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.  
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am. 

FILED: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, and Elements of the Offense/Jury Instructions.

Defendant Wakim Leon Bryant Jr in Court, in custody.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke appeared by video for Wakim Leon Bryant Jr.  Attorney Jacob Daniel Corr in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. Defense counsel is ready to proceed. State is ready to proceed. Case passed to address remainder of the Court's calendar. Parties instructed to appear at 1:30pm.
Order Granting Viewing of Electronic Discovery.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Wakim Leon Bryant not in court, in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. BRANCH 4 for BRANCH 46.   Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Case remains calendared in Branch 46.
Notice of Motion for Viewing of Electronic Discovery.

Defendant Wakim Leon Bryant in Court with Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Wakim Leon Bryant in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Defendant and Defense appeared via Zoom Video Conference. Defense advised the Court of inability to meet with Defendant at HOC. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. State placed offer on the record. Offer to remain open. Court addressed Defense Motion for Reduction of Bail. State was NOT able to comply with Victim Notification; therefore, Bail/Bond hearing will be held in Branch 4 (Pair Judge). No additional issues need to be addressed at this time. Court ordered case adjourned for Bail/Bond hearing and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Bail/Bond hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:15 am. Hearing will be held in Room 629 of the Courthouse.  
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
State's Witness List; received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine; received and filed.
Defense Witness List; received and filed.
Defense Notice and Motion for Reduction of Bail; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Wakim L. Bryant, Jr. - #2022003925, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Final PreTrial is scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm. 
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. 
Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference. 
Information provided to MCSO.

Defense contacted the Court and State via email regarding Final PreTrial. Defense received a new offer and requested time to review with Defendant. State confirmed. 
NEW DATE: Final PreTrial scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:30 am. 
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. 
Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant previously entered a DEMAND FOR SPEEDY TRIAL on June 10, 2022.
EXPIRATION DATE: SEPTEMBER 8, 2022.

Defendant Wakim Leon Bryant in Court with Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Wakim Leon Bryant in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material and an offer from the State. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 
Final PreTrial scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:45 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Wakim Leon Bryant in court, appear by video with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke, appear by video.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective C. Donahue.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Wakim Leon Bryant in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Wakim Leon Bryant in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**

Case calendared for an Order to Show Cause hearing. The State Public Defender's Office has appointed Attorney Wineke. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

-received and filed. 
Attorney Annamarie Wineke
Per Chief Judge Directive 21 - 13, this case should be transferred from Judge Hanrahan to Br. 4 Judge David Feiss, Br. 46.

Defendant Wakim Leon Bryant not in court, defendant in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Wakim Leon Bryant not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Wakim Leon Bryant not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact/No Firearms Order.  Defendant to have no contact with M.A.W. (DOB: 3/12/92).

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.

Defendant Wakim Leon Bryant in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Wakim Leon Bryant in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
